results.title: Touch the Sun: Top enders
results.creator_credit: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Mick, a boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and the families they have fled from. Cast includes John Jarratt, Madeleine Blackwell, Bennendine Woods, Donald Dale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Bush and beach around Melbourne
results.brief_description:
This film is made up of various scenes of coastal and bush areas in and around Victoria: life saving display at St. Kilda; some views around the beaches to Portsea; bathers and motor boating across the bay to Queenscliff; into the nearest ranges, fields of daffodils around Healesville, Marysville and Warburton districts; gun-dogs in action; fly-fishing; the Dandenong ranges.
No credits available.

results.title: The Queen Mother at Essendon Airport
results.brief_description:
Silent footage of the arrival on 27 February 1958 of the Queen Mother at Essendon Airport to a welcoming crowd of waving spectators, military parades and marching bands, and government officials and dignitaries. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Melbourne city parade
results.brief_description: Silent film of the Queen Mother arriving at the Melbourne Town Hall during a Moomba parade. Includes scenes of crowds lining Swanston Street; the Lord Mayor’s welcoming speech to the Queen Mother; and her departure in an open car as she waves to the crowd. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Maroondah Dam
results.brief_description:
Silent 1950s home movie footage of a family outing to the Maroondah Dam in the Upper Yarra Valley. Includes images of the landscape and boating facilities. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Mallacoota fishing trip
results.brief_description:
Mallacoota - There is boatloads of nostalgic charm in this short black and white 1950s film of men taking a fishing trip at Mallacoota. Photographer Athol Adams has captured a sense of fun in this footage, made more entertaining to modern eyes because of the formal clothes the fishermen are wearing. A wonderful glimpse of a different generation at play.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: The Mallee tree
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: With its roots deeply set in the earth the humble Mallee finds its strength to face the uncertain challenges of nature. Its tenacity to survive and live on through long droughts and harsh weather conditions is symbolic of the Birchip community who also face similar challenges in their own lives. Written and performed by Glenys Rickard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development

results.title: The Birchip Cropping Group
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: A background history of the Birchip Cropping Group, an agricultural research and extension organisation covering the Wimmera Mallee region set up to assist farmers in crop production. Its philosophy is to produce food that is clean, safe and green. Presented by Alexandra, Fiona, James, Simon and the BCG.

results.title: Reid Mather - on the farm
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Reid Mather, Mayor of Buloke Shire at the time of filming, talks about his family’s own farming history and his personal relationship with the land.
